website_summaries.verdict: Streamlined design and solid feel make this a great pick for the modern kitchen.
pros: Includes a sweep spray, aerated flow, and pause settings for excellent versatility
cons: May drip if turned off in the sweep setting

customer_reviews.title: five warranty claims in less than three years
customer_reviews.text: We've had nothing but problems with this faucet. Specifically, we've replaced the spray head three times because of leaking and the hose twice because of leaking. Kohler has sent replacement parts for free under the lifetime warranty but it takes a couple of weeks for the parts to come. Regardless, having to submit five warranty claims in less than three years makes me regret buying this faucet. I pointed this out to Kohler on my last claim asking if they would refund my money. They chose not to respond to that part of my email. I will never buy a Kohler faucet again. I suggest you don't either.
customer_reviews.author: Pro.Sjo

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY - Kohler doesn't stand behind their products
customer_reviews.text: Received the unit and had a very experienced plumber install. The unit leaked from the inside and was spraying water when used underneath the sink. We immediately called Kohler and had the plumber speak with them. They would not replace the unit, and would only send what they suspect was a faulty or missing "O" Ring for the plumber to install. Are you kidding me, we're paying a plumber to fix the defective new unit?. The plumber said it's only Kohler units that he's occasionally run into this. So $200+ plumbers bill and have to return the unit to Amazon. Never again!!!
customer_reviews.author: David Fitch

customer_reviews.title: Great Product... But DON'T buy from Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Received package with factory seal opened. Noticed corrosion at fittings and proceeded to remove from box... lo and behold, water dripping from the hoses and sprayer- just like other reviews from Amazon. Be warned, Amazon apparently ships products that have been returned. One user said when they received their replacement for the used product, Amazon shipped another with the same problem with not one, but two more factory seals overlapping, meaning they sent another that had been returned *twice*. Be warned. Don't count this faucet out, it's a beauty in style and quality... just don't buy it from here.
customer_reviews.author: dbcbiz

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in this faucet
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this faucet. Poor design and construction. Small drippy leak under the handle almost immediately after installation, causing our granite countertop to remain constantly wet. Within 18 months of installation, the stream pause button fell off. Then, several months later, the water hose developed a small hole under the sink, spraying all inside our cabinet, causing a huge mess. Koehler was very helpful to send a replacement faucet, however after installing the replacement, we discovered the spray nozzle buttons were defective and not working, wouldn't stay in either spray or stream mode, making a mess with every use. Contacted Koehler again today, and they are now sending an entirely different model faucet. Hopefully, third time is a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Mommy2girls

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful faucet... but a little over a year and it's already drip, drip, drippig...
customer_reviews.text: Original Post: 10/27/2014: Love this faucet! Great quality... New Post: 12/07/2015: The faucet now drips on the bottom side of the faucet handle. Need to find out how to replace the cartridge and/or washers. I counted on this Kohler kitchen faucet to be of decent quality. It's unfortunate, I now have to figure out how to replace whatever is causing the faucet to leak. 45 single, faucet still not fixed, and frustrated with the drip, drip, drip...
customer_reviews.author: Janelle

customer_reviews.title: Water hose leak from two places after less than 3 years of use
customer_reviews.text: I thought Kohler was a reputable premium brand, so it is really disappointing to have this issue after less than 3 years of use. Bought and installed in Jan 2016, then 3 month ago the hose it started leaking from where it connects to the sprayer. I used a hose repair tape on it, didn't fix it but controlled the leak enough that it can still be used. Then today while washing dishes I had water pouring out from the cabinet below the sink, turns out there is a big leak from the hose where the metal weight is hanging to retract the sprayer. Now I have to replace the whole faucet again. Be aware.
customer_reviews.author: J. Carlisle

customer_reviews.title: The faucet leaked from the handle area from the moment ...
customer_reviews.text: The faucet leaked from the handle area from the moment it was installed. It was sent to me with by Amazon with a cartridge and nut that were stripped out. I contacted Kohler since the faucet was already installed and I didn't want to remove it. Kohler sent me a replacement cartridge, but it continued to leak, although the leak was slower. Kohler told me that nothing else could be done expect buy a new faucet.
customer_reviews.author: Hanna D.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible don't buy this
customer_reviews.text: It works and was easy to install..I will post further updates if any issues develop. I was a little sad that it is smaller like skinner the my old faucet and the water pressure seems different, less water comes out so it takes longer for the sink to fill. For the price I guess it was good considering some that we looked at were 400$. I think i paid about 200 for this one. Update: this faucet is leaking everywhere water from around the handle and the pull down part of the hose. Spent way to much this didnt even last the year from when I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: megcar

customer_reviews.title: Check it over before installation.
customer_reviews.text: I would have given it a 5 star rating except after I had a professional plumber install the faucet we turned it on and the handle fell off. We looked at it and there was no set screw in the handle. I ordered two set screws from the Kohler web site. $2.10 for each set screw plus $8.00 for shipping. I found this upsetting and unprofessional. Hope we don't have any more problems.
customer_reviews.author: Old Geezer

customer_reviews.title: Excellant Choice !
customer_reviews.text: Installation was super easy. The long supply lines make having an additional supply line and connection unnecessary. Handle works smoothly. On is on, off is off and variable in between. The faucet is high enough to get my largest kettle below for filling and the magnetic spout holder locks the spout in place with minimal effort. Having the straight line sprayer vs the "round" type makes rinsing a breeze, especially pushing suds down the sink and with 3 options of line spray, full flow or combination of, it suits many needs. Kitchen scale please
customer_reviews.author: Rael

customer_reviews.title: it works
customer_reviews.text: It works very, very well. The water pressure is great; I really like the spray function that sprays at an angle. I love Kohler's customer service; it came with the power button broken. It took one email, and they sent a new spray head. So why 3 stars? Two reasons. The hose does NOT retract easily. My husband had to put another weight--in addition to the included one--and I still have to feed it back in, with difficulty. But mostly, the look of it. The pictures make it look sleek. In person, it looks anorexic. My own opinion, but I love the function and hate the form.
customer_reviews.author: july

customer_reviews.title: Falling sprayhead
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these and had them brought to Brazil. When they got here one of them had a faulty magnet so the sprayhead won't stay connected to the body, it keeps hanging lose. Also, both of them still had water in them (!!). Paid more for Kohler thinking it was a high quality brand. Guess I was mistaken. DON'T BUY KOHLER
customer_reviews.author: Felipe C. C. Rodrigues

customer_reviews.title: A+ for beauty of design & functionality.  C- for durability
customer_reviews.text: Love the look, love the function! However...only 3 years since installation, the connection between spigot/sprayer and hose is leaking. We expected better from Kohler. :-( NOW we shall see how they stand behind their product....We are 2 empty-nesters. The wear and tear we put on our kitchen is minimal, so to have this obvious stress point give up after only 3 years is disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Average Quality, Decent Value
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item for $166 from Amazon, expected a little better quality but am happy overall. Not as heavy duty as I'd like. The tall faucet swivels too easily and does not reliably stay in place until the water flow is on and high--messy if you have split corner sinks as I do. Well packaged, instructions are complete and easy to follow, installation (including removal of old faucet) took less than an hour with basic hand tools. Spray/steam selector works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my American Standard Bar Silhouette bar sink.
customer_reviews.text: Used to replaced an American Standard Hampton Two Handle Faucet for my American Standard Bar Silhouette bar sink. Wanted a faucet with taller and deeper reach and this in one of the few faucets that was the perfect size. Combined with the Kohler 13478-A-CP -4 Escutcheon Plate rounded to cover the exposed holes in the three-hole sink.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Kitchen Faucet
customer_reviews.text: Installed this myself in my daughter's house, replacing an older model that had SOME HOW lost its control buttons (kids!!!). And unlike EVERY plumbing job I've EVER done, this one did NOT require multiple trips to Lowes or HD to get parts that fit or to replace ones that leak. Kit came with everything needed to install and it all worked!!! Didn't take long to install and was pretty straight forward. All functions are extremely smooth, like silky butter! Also, I got it "used" through Amazon Warehouse - saved a ton of $$ and its just like new (can't tell it was ever sold & returned, so it was a great deal). Highly Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Jumbo Jim

customer_reviews.title: Solid, Modern Kohler Kitchen faucet
customer_reviews.text: Design is great--look wonderful as a replacement for a similar Kohler faucet which had run its course. We like the size and simple, elegant shape of this faucet. The buttons to adjust from stream to spray are concealed in the back--some other faucets have the buttons facing outwards, which seems weird to me....why would you want to see buttons? The spray mode comes on very strong and has a fan pattern. You just have to decrease the power of the water flow quite a bit or you will get spray splashing everywhere. The head pulls out and retracts well back into place. Overall, a very nice faucet which we bought for a good price via amazon.
customer_reviews.author: KDCSF

customer_reviews.title: BEST Faucet EVER!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this faucet since 2016 and have had to replace to minor pieces both of which were immediately without question replaced by Kohler. One part i just had replaced today and the other the beginning of the year. Highly recommend this faucet. I've never had a faucet last for this length of time in the kitchen let alone remain in near perfect condition!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph C Brunner

customer_reviews.title: KOHLER K-596-VS
customer_reviews.text: So far I like everything about the new faucet except for the flow volume of the water. The 40 year old faucet passed more water than the new, which I assume has an energy saving flow rate. It appears the government believes if I fill a gallon bucket of water slower, that the bucket will shrink during the fill, and I'll use less water.
customer_reviews.author: OXCOM

customer_reviews.title: Stylish.  Quality.  Money Well Spent.
customer_reviews.text: A kitchen faucet is one of the most utilized pieces of hardware in one's house. I looked at many similarly styled faucets at the big box stores and they did not have the solid feel of this one. This is a high quality and stylish example that will surely last many years. It is somewhat of a bold/statement piece, so double check the dimensions and area you're installing it. For us, anything smaller wouldn't have worked well with the large stainless farm sink in our kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Best Kitchen Faucet EVER!
customer_reviews.text: We recently had this faucet installed after a kitchen remodel. The hands free start-stop is fantastic, especially with COVID issues. No more touching the handle, and wiping up endless splashes underneath. The reach is 9", which is adequate, but we would have preferred 10 or 11" since our sink is so big. It looks sleek, which is good because you can see it from everywhere in the downstairs. Since it works with an adapter, not batteries, we will never find ourselves without power to get automatic water. Thank you Kohler!
customer_reviews.author: Houston Trumpets

customer_reviews.title: Great sleek faucet
customer_reviews.text: Sleek and fantastic look. I needed a plumber to install because of necessity of changing out water valves. Pressure and temperature is much better than prior (builder installed) faucet. I love the angled spray. Even though the hose does not automatically snap back, it uses a floating weight, so just a little push and then it magnetically attaches. Oh ... and I got lucky, the handle fully turns without hitting the granite backsplash. Guess I should have checked those specs before, but it works. PS, my plumber loves this faucet. He’s confident I will get many trouble free years from it.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Rain

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, smooth contours easy to keep clean (no decorative crevices). Easy to install, but I had to go get brass adapters between the 3/8 compression fittings this comes with, and my 1/2 inch iron pipe supply valves. The supply hoses this comes with are long enough that I did not need to use any supply tubing. Replacing a 3-hole faucet, the included 3-hole cover fit well, looks good, and covers up the marks from the old one. I also had to get new plumber's putty to seal this adapter, my old can of putty had dried out.
customer_reviews.author: M. Luce

customer_reviews.title: LEAKS after less than 5 months
customer_reviews.text: I loved this faucet at first, but it leaks after less than 6 months of use. Leaks by the handle and onto the countertop, flooding everything. Yes, Kohler will send new cartridge but I shouldn't have to repair a NEW faucet. We bought through Amazon seller Adams Quality Plumbing. They have been very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: VeeeeryInteresting

customer_reviews.title: We wanted to love this faucet
customer_reviews.text: We wanted to love this faucet, but unfortunately there was no water pressure when we had it installed. The plumber told us that Kohler, similar to other manufacturers, includes multiple water flow restrictors inside the faucet, but Kohler doesn’t publish where they are so it’s nearly impossible to remove them yourself and get ample water pressure from the faucet. This faucet literally barely filled a half-gallon container in a minute. So we returned it in favor of the Grohe K7. Same deal with restrictors but checking it the reviews—super helpful with detailed instructions on how to remove. Pressure is great. We love the Grohe.
customer_reviews.author: G. Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Slender faucet. Missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after tons of searching for our kitchen remodel. I paired it with a 32”x20” stainless steel apron farmhouse sink, which makes this already slender faucet look even skinnier. It is a very sleek design and is physically appealing, but would look better on a less ginormous sink. Spray level is good. Biggest complaint is that the very important O-ring was not included which meant there was a leak any time the faucet was on. Called kohler for replacement and received a strange plastic tube instead of an O-ring. So, im currently stuck with a pretty, leaky faucet
customer_reviews.author: Megan Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Easy install, great features.
customer_reviews.text: Goes great with our Blanco anthracite colored undermount sink. The magnet in the spout holds the nozzle firmly but doesn't make it hard to pull out the nozzle. Installation was easy, even though it had to be done after both the sink and granite countertop were in place. Generous length of the supply tubes allowed installation to valves without stressing the supply tubes. The nozzle glides in and out of the spout with no drag or hang-ups. Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Swar

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but has some issues
customer_reviews.text: Looks and works ok. The 2 issues that I have is: 1. Lower flow when using the regular stream. The spray is fine though. 2. The weight that pulls the spray head back into the body works terribly. You have to push it back into place.
customer_reviews.author: JWINK

customer_reviews.title: Installation NIGHTMARE + Poor design
customer_reviews.text: The brass main post and very odd-shaped brass nut have very shallow, thin threads and strip very easily. If it doesn't strip upon installation it will definitely strip when you try to remove the faucet - ended up having to cut the hoses in order to remove it. The reason I had to remove it (replaced it with an easy-to-install Moen) is because the pulldown hose is jammed into the same column with the water hoses and would not retract without having to force it back in using both hands. (Moen was easy to install and hose retracts by itself as soon as you let it go.)
customer_reviews.author: ADRPRO

customer_reviews.title: Useful features and good quality at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Used this to replace a faucet that had started leaking. Much too soon to judge durability, but we're very satisfied so far. The gooseneck shape gives room underneath to wash large items, the sprayer setting gives a powerful jet of water, the control lever works well, and there's a general impression of good quality.
customer_reviews.author: lm

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this faucet from amazon and when we opened the package there no parts in the box. The only thing was the faucet structure with no way to install it. I have read other reviews on amazon that also received boxes that were opened and missing parts. I don't know if amazon receives these items from the manufacturer like this or if they are just sending out returned item that got put back in circulation without checking the items. In any case, it was frustrating to have to return it and wait even longer to be able to use our kitchen sink.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Withers

customer_reviews.title: Failed after one month
customer_reviews.text: The spray button stuck after one month. I contacted Kohler and they of course sent me a new one right away. I replaced it and sent the old one back for analysis as they suggested but the new one also stuck after about a couple weeks.. Would only give it one star if not for the great Kohler service. I'm shopping for a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Cruiser Gary

customer_reviews.title: Looks really good
customer_reviews.text: This looks really good, but some of the parts have the feel of very cheap plastic. I will see how it holds up. I would only knock it one start for that because it does look nice. The plastic parts are internal at the spray head connections and like. But the water splashes everywhere when using this faucet. It's almost like there is no aerator. My wife will not do dishes now without wearing an apron as it gets her all wet. Overall I'm ok with the purchase. Was easy to install and functions. If the plastic parts fail later I won't be too upset replacing it though.
customer_reviews.author: diyguy

customer_reviews.title: Nice with a minor flaw
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice looking piece, however the high pressure button gets stuck a lot and has to be wiggled to disengage. The spray is strong and cleans most anything off a plate, but due to the pressure creates a mist of water if you do not spray far down into the sink.
customer_reviews.author: 78Foxes

customer_reviews.title: Clearly, Kohler is having issues with this faucet, ...
customer_reviews.text: Clearly, Kohler is having issues with this faucet, as ours is leaking too. Installed 6 months ago, and it's leaking both from the handle valve and under the sink - and we've sustained significant damage to the cabinet. Had to email customer service and try to get a warranty repair. A new kitchen faucet shouldn't leak, period. Would avoid.
customer_reviews.author: MonteBurns

customer_reviews.title: Great product - so easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a higher faucet with a sprayer and this one definitely fits the bill. The instructions are so easy to understand and I love the fact it has braided lines for the water connections. I actually purchased and returned a similar Delta model that was more expensive because it had plastic water lines. Just watch the sprayer as it is powerful and will cause spray back on you and the surrounding counter area.
customer_reviews.author: Jojo Willis

customer_reviews.title: From the beginning the faucet handle became stiff and difficult ...
customer_reviews.text: From the beginning the faucet handle became stiff and difficult to use, also the spray head button wont work so we just use the stream position. I paid close to $200 and a $100 to install, so to much of a hassle to return! Quality control was asleep when this one passed by.
customer_reviews.author: Frizzer88

customer_reviews.title: Leaks at connection between faucet and handle
customer_reviews.text: This faucet leaked at the connection between the handle and the faucet from day 1. Unfortunately I didn't actually install it until about 6 months after I initially bought it (projects tend to creep along the calendar that way), so I couldn't return it, but I see that several other people had the same problem, so it is obviously a manufacturing defect. Very disappointing for a faucet at this price...
customer_reviews.author: Pablo

customer_reviews.title: Nice-Looking, Functional Faucet BUT...
customer_reviews.text: We really liked the look and functionality of this faucet, but the hose/quick connect section sprung a slow leak that we didn't catch, which ran under the cabinets and wooden floor causing that area to buckle under an area rug. Big bummer. We'll see what happens when Kohler sends a new hose.
customer_reviews.author: Rlraine

customer_reviews.title: Hose leaks after 4 years in service - Not Happy
customer_reviews.text: As many others noted, the hose eventually leaks (mine leaks after 4 years). This must be a common problem as the manufacture's video "How to Replace a Hose in Your Pullout Kitchen Faucet" has nearly 800,000 views. Contacted manufacturer who shipped a replacement hose, which is great, but the warranty doesn't cover the cost of repairing my damaged wood floor. Removing the old hose was impossible. The collet connection absolutely would not come apart, despite every effort. Ended up cutting the hose to remove (and trash) the entire faucet. Replacing it with a different brand. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: F. COALE

customer_reviews.title: Pause button changed to Boost button on latest model.
customer_reviews.text: One of the reason I bought this model rather than a cheaper one was because of the pause button. My sister-in-law has the same one and it works great. However, the pause button was changed to a "boost" button that increases water pressure (the exact opposite of what I wanted/expected). I checked Kohler's website and it makes no mention of the pause functionality, but described the boost button. Needless to say, after spending a few hours including a trip to the hardware store to install this, I'm pretty disappointed. Not sure if I'm going to return it or just live with it and see if the boost function grows on me.
customer_reviews.author: Tony F

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly Great
customer_reviews.text: I feel I did much research on this and I wasn’t disappointed. It was the easiest faucet I have ever installed. But there is a purging process that requires the short hose be placed in a bucket while running the water for a minute. Luckily I had a larger hose that I placed over it to direct the water. The instructions look as if the line is longer and can be placed in a bucket. Otherwise it’s the smoothest working faucet I have ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Big Dave

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking and  Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: We installed two of these. Very easy to install and very nice looking. The sprayer hose works nicely too. There are two nozzle patterns: A basic flow and a neat looking v-shaped shower head pattern. Unfortunately, the latter pattern creates such a strong stream of water jets that they bounce off the dishes and splash water everywhere. You can adjust the flow down to use this feature. Then when you want to switch back to the regular pattern, you need to turn the flow back up. Not a big deal, but seems like a correctable design "feature".
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Large Profile Faucet Installs Easily and Works Well. Great Water Pressure
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product. It is fairly large, though, so it takes a bit of getting used to. It installs easily and the water pressure is wonderful. I love the pause feature as well as the stream and spray options. As other reviewers have noted the water is quick to jump outside the sink depending on how high you turn it on. This also takes a bit of getting used to. After 2 months, everything seems to be working very well.
customer_reviews.author: AnnieSez

customer_reviews.title: Not Recommended - Spray is Too Intense and Head Clogs Easily
customer_reviews.text: The spray is way to high pressure and any effort to lower it by the handle renders it useless - buy a MOEN faucet! Also, after 3+ years, the spray head became clogged and is impossible to clean. Kohler should stick to toilets and porcelain and golf courses.
customer_reviews.author: G. Liechty

customer_reviews.title: Slick
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time, but the seal and tape was broken, as if the package had been opened. Kind of strange. I checked everything out, look it all over and it seemed OK to me. So I installed it have to say very easy install. I have over the years put a few of these things in,hardest part about this install was crawling in and out from under the sink, of course maybe being 74 might have something to do with that. All and all this was very simple and the faucet it self work great.
customer_reviews.author: jerry

customer_reviews.title: Well-constructed, well-designed faucet
customer_reviews.text: This faucet is amazing, if a consummate pain in the butt to install. Pros: Construction is immaculate and incredibly functional Drop-down head and spray characteristics are fantastic and auto-click perfectly back into place No flimsy parts anywhere--Kohler didn't cheap out when it came to machining any part of this Cons: Instructions are somewhat incomplete and assume you've installed a faucet before The gasket has to go in one specific direction, and it's not well-indicated in the installation instructions Bottom-line: If you can install, and have a single-hole build, this is the faucet for you
customer_reviews.author: Stefan Castino

customer_reviews.title: Pick this Kohler faucet
customer_reviews.text: New faucet for my mother in laws kitchen sink. It has stream or spray options and a push button that stops the flow so you can turn on the water, adjust the temperature to what you want, push button to stop water flow pull out faucet hose to large pot or bucket, release button, fill item, push button again to stop flow and return the hose into original position and not get a drop of water anywhere you don't want one. Its wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: HG-Washington

customer_reviews.title: gorgeous design. perfect fitting. easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: GET READY FOR COMPLIMENTS! We picked this because of its functionality but in addition, this is a gorgeous product. Makes an incredible statement visually. In addition, it is perfectly fitted and very easy to install with crystal-clear instructions. In 10 minutes it was installed and my home boss was wondering "why did we wait so long to upgrade?". Tells you something. And after a week now, she says this faucet stays cleaner as well...water runs off it and she wipes it clean easily. Nice.
customer_reviews.author: NL

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Had to replace my 20 year-old Kohler bar faucet ('snif) - still functional, but the retaining clip rusted-out. This one was the closest, and was a very simple drop-in replacement. De-coupled the old unit, dropped the new one into the same hole, added some new teflon tape, and all is well in the bar sink again. This was a great price vs. retail, and better than the bar sink version of this one, which had no spray head.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really love this faucet!
customer_reviews.text: This faucet is solid steel (other reviewers said the spray head was not metal, but mine is). I find because of its high neck, I rarely need to pull the faucet head down which will help extend the life of the extending hose. This just feels like a quality product, and I am super happy with my purchase. Should the faucet fail in the next year or so, I will be back to update, but I feel pretty good about this product so far.
customer_reviews.author: lazylegs

customer_reviews.title: Disaster strikes, But Kohler fixed it
customer_reviews.text: Broke within 2 weeks. Contacted Kohler and they called back, they will send the broken part and I will have to take it apart myself and fix it.... Broken part is back ordered and will take about 4 weeks. So, so far just a disaster.... Update! Kohler contacted me again and they sent me a new faucet. So far works like a charm. Hope it stays that way. Now a happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: geogeo

customer_reviews.title: Best faucet I Have ever had !!!
customer_reviews.text: I have always had metal hose pullout heads but I love this one better as it is smoother in and out motion. The best part of this product is the sweep spray head which does a great job of cleaning food off the dishes and sink walls and bottom. Also the water volume increase button fills my coffee pot and soup pot much quicker. This is one great faucet.
customer_reviews.author: P. Daniel

customer_reviews.title: I really like this faucet!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install and it is a very nice design. Sleek without lots of ridges that would need constant cleaning. The on-off handle is easy to use (just be sure you have enough clearance behind the faucet so it doesn't hit the backsplash. The handle can be positioned in front in that case,) The dual spray is great and it is handy to have the pause button. So far I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: FloridaGirl

customer_reviews.title: Only KOHLER
customer_reviews.text: I love the style of the KOHLER Simplice faucet. It's simply but beautifully designed for a contemporary or modern Chefs kitchen. Perfect size and height for cleaning large pots and the pull-down sprayer functions perfectly. Always slides smoothly back into place without having to guide it. My only high maintenance complaint is it sprays so hard the entire sink and counter area gets wet - even with a larger sink. But that's not a design or quality issue, just my issue. KOHLER only designs the best!
customer_reviews.author: Kash Kow

customer_reviews.title: Water volume/pressure button permanently breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: After about a year in service, the water pressure volume/button on the head stopped working and it's stuck on high pressure. When using feature during the year, I noticed that this button stopped working when hot water was being delivered, so don't expected to control water volume/pressure with hot water. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Mounting nut would not attache
customer_reviews.text: I have the same model in my home for 10 years, it is perfect. I have installed many kitchen faucets. Kohler has changed the mounting shaft and nut from brass to aluminum. The treads would not catch; tried several times on the counter to get it to start. Went to Home Depot bought another Kohler, slightly different exterior shape, same inside. Same result; the mounting nut would not start. It will likely take Kohler a year to sort this out. Ending up buying a Delta to finish the job.
customer_reviews.author: js51

customer_reviews.title: Works well but not all functions present
customer_reviews.text: I'm looking for the pause feature. Maybe my model doesn't have it? The sprinkler and direct spray work well as does the power stream button. Retractable? The hose retracts and docks securely, but there is no auto-retract... you have to push the hose back inside and dock it manually, otherwise it lays hanging out. These aren't major things, but a bit disappointing. The look is very nice though and seems like good quality after a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: David Rebhun

customer_reviews.title: Like it but they changed the function of the hose button
customer_reviews.text: I like this faucet a lot. I installed one about two years ago in a prior home and just put it in my new home. The only thing that disappointed me this time is they changed one of the functions. The button used to pause the water flow so you could stretch the hose to fill a pot etc., but the button on the new faucet boosts the water flow instead of pausing it. Not the end of the world, but it was a surprising change that I will miss. Otherwise, the faucet is beautiful and has a great simple design.
customer_reviews.author: A. Starr

customer_reviews.title: Snazzy faucet with good flow.
customer_reviews.text: Kohler kitchen faucets are a breeze to install. The main nut is twisted into place by hand and two perpendicular screws tension the joint. One giant phillips screwdriver and an adjustable wrench for water connections is all that's required. This one has good flow. The wand spray feature is a nice touch as well.
customer_reviews.author: maniac121

customer_reviews.title: I love it! The faucet is very easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I researched a lot of faucet brands before deciding on the Kohler Simplice. I love it! The faucet is very easy to install, it's sturdy, has a magnetic docking for the sprayer, and it rotates 360 degrees. Some customers said that they positioned the faucet so that the handle is in front (I did too ~ great idea). The only concern is that on the bottom of the handle is a hole that a little screw goes into ~ my faucet didn't have the screw or else it came out during the shipping. Customer Service was great and they sent me 2 free screws.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: I Love This Faucet!!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a pull down faucet - not pull out - pull down. I've tried pull down faucets and am not coordinated enough to avoid getting water all over me and the floor while pulling toward me. This faucet pulls down effortlessly. The "blade" stream really does get most good off plates, and the pause button comes in handy if moving to fill a pan. The fact that the sprayer is right there on the faucet means it's really convenient for cleaning the sink, acting like one of those swivel nozzles to direct the spray around the sink without even pulling it out. I've already suggested this faucet to my neighbor and my mom.
customer_reviews.author: K. Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit in our Motor Home
customer_reviews.text: This faucet worked great in our 1998 American Dream Motor home, it took me a long time to find a pull down style that had a small enough base to fit in this application. Note: the water lines on this model use 3/8 female copper line fittings, you'll need two adapters to go from 1/2" NPT male to 3/8 copper tubing style male to connect the hoses. The hole in the sink did need to be enlarged to fit the faucet stem, little bit of work with a die grinder was all it took. The magnetic head works really well, snaps right into position
customer_reviews.author: John Heard

customer_reviews.title: Good but could be better
customer_reviews.text: This faucet looks nice and is simple like I was wanting. It does not have a stop in it so it can swing all the way around if you do not have a wall behind the faucet like me. Not a deal breaker but something I have to look out for. Also the weight on the hose isn’t heavy enough to pull the pull down nozzle back into the neck of the faucet so I have to push it back in. Definitely a pain when the faucet moves around so easily. But once the nozzle is in it doesn’t fall out so that’s great. Due to the price I had expected better.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Biniasz

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: Installed 3 months ago and no problems. Installation of the faucet was easy. I like it a lot better than than the Delta the builder provided 10 years ago. It looks and feels solid. The black finish is very good. The spray setting is very strong and can cause some water to ricochet out of the sink. It is easy to resolve this by not turning the faucet on fully when using the spray. The faucet can be installed with the handle facing any direction. I installed mine with the handle centered in front of the faucet. That made it easy to control right of left handed
customer_reviews.author: GordonZ

customer_reviews.title: Easy install with one minor gripe
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install without requiring a basin wrench or similar to reach up into the dark recesses of your cabinet. My only complaint is that they supply a rather small zip tie to secure the retraction weight to the hose, but it’s so small the weight easily slips past it. Just use a “normal” sized zip tie instead and all is well.
customer_reviews.author: W. A. Leddy

customer_reviews.title: Too many plumber visits
customer_reviews.text: This is a great faucet in many ways, easy to control temperature, fill large pots, spray the sink. BUT, we paid for a plumber to install it in February 2017. In November 2018, the handle started to become very stiff to operate, then began leaking from the handle. The plumber came back, told me to call Kohler who sent a replacement valve for no cost with their lifetime guarantee. Here we are in July 2019 and I'm getting ready to call Kohler again for the same problem. This time I hope we can install the new valve ourselves. The plumbing bills have surpassed the cost of the faucet.
customer_reviews.author: DDL

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, bad spray nozzle
customer_reviews.text: I am a licensed contractor and had no problem installing this with the basic tools. Within one week of installing this faucet the spray nozzle "power boost" button stuck in the boost mode and will not turn off so when you turn it on it is at full blast all the time. I will be contacting the supplier for a replacement part.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Weak stream.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this faucet for our beautiful lake home property. While installing I noticed that the hot & cold water feeds were smaller then any faucet I’ve ever seen. The small diameter of the tubing results in a very week water pressure stream. Really disappointing. The extra pressure feature helps a little but will not stay on without holding on. Not good.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J

customer_reviews.title: High/Low Flow Button Gets Stuck
customer_reviews.text: Although this is a great faucet, as several reviewers have pointed out, the High/Low Flow button gets stuck in the High Flow position. Many have changed out the head under warranty but the problem remained in some cases. I just leave mine alone and stuck in the high flow position -- not sure getting another head will solve the problem -- defect in engineering.
customer_reviews.author: Randolph Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Found a perfect match for our needs.
customer_reviews.text: Prior pullout faucet failed and needed equal or better for our kitchen. After extensive research settled on the Simplice and we love the spray options and magnetic feature to lock sprayer back in place. Hose reach is more than sufficient and install was a breeze. We are happy customers.
customer_reviews.author: RL Pearson

customer_reviews.title: In love with my new faucet!!!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely pleased with this faucet and the price here on Amazon. I shopped around a lot before deciding on this fixture for my cast iron double sink. It's a perfect mix of form and function and brings a contemporary edge to my more classic kitchen. Best of all the price beat out all the other big box sellers. Installation was a breeze for my handy father in law, but without him I'd probably have hired a plumber. I have a standard faucet setup and this was a smooth fit with the cover plate. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: jacqueline gomersall

customer_reviews.title: Really disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Got a professional to install and found the quick connect to the hose had a part missing or the adapter was the wrong size. I have had to order a replacement Quick connect from Kohler and still waiting for it. I am truly disappointed and crestfallen.
customer_reviews.author: Amarnath Mcpherson

customer_reviews.title: Clean look and very functional faucet.
customer_reviews.text: I replaced kitchen faucet that was leaking around the spray area with this one. Easy to install - took about 30 minutes. The arch spray is stronger than previous faucet, but easy to adjust with water control lever. Only concern was the handle - had to place in front rather then side because the handle for the hot water hit the splash panel and therefore could not completely open. I wish the handle were mounted higher since I prefer the handle on the side. As such, I am giving the faucet a 4-star rating. Otherwise, a clean look and very functional faucet. I am ordering a second one in black for my vacation home.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Friend

customer_reviews.title: Perfect match
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a Simplice model bar sink faucet for our island to match the main sink Simplice faucet in our new kitchen and this was perfect. We did have one issue: the hot water supply line was tagged "cold", clearly a mistake at the factory. After consulting with Kohler support via email, I had to swap the water line connections (and for my future sanity moved the tag, too).
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: Great faucet, but short water connections for us.
customer_reviews.text: The faucet was easy to install. The only problem we had was that the hose connections were too short to reach our water lines from the previous faucet. An extra trip to the hardware store for extensions was needed. But the faucet works great and looks awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Joy Reinhard

customer_reviews.title: Leaking After 14 Months!
customer_reviews.text: This was great to start with, but just 14 months later, it's leaking and spraying all over the place from tiny holes in the hose. What a waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Am I glad I bought this faucet!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is just an awesome faucet. I love it! It is good looking and the water pressure even on spray setting is excellent. When my plumber came to install it he said it was the same faucet he has. Also he says it does have a cartridge that occasionally would need to be replaced but he had had this faucet for five years already and it still has the original cartridge.
customer_reviews.author: jjkaiser

customer_reviews.title: Started to leak after less than a month!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, modern looking kitchen faucet that's easy to install yourself. So far have had no problems with this item. REVISED REVIEW (2/14): It seems I spoke a little too soon. The faucet is leaking from the handle after less than a month of installation!!!!! I guess we will see how good Kohler is with their lifetime warranty.
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality to update your kitchen.
customer_reviews.text: We replaced the original kitchen sink faucet with this baby and it works and looks great. The metal construction exudes quality and really makes the kitchen look better overall. We found the install easy also for those who are moderately handy. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Steven N. Gosney

customer_reviews.title: Stop button does not work.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 3 of these facits now and happy with them other then the third one I purchased the button on the sprayer for stopping flow does not work. The rest of it is great and workds great. I really like the swivel in the sprayer head that alloys you to direct the water to the side or differnt direction then just straight down, nice feature. Also the fanned spray pattern is very nice, helps cover bigger areas. Would not be afraid to purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff W.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Works great. Looks great. The "pause" and "water blade" buttons / features are very useful when rinsing fruits / vegetables. The "water blade" button / feature (at higher flow-rate) also facilitates removal of stuck-on foods and oils from pots and pans. Prior to making my purchase, I researched and evaluated several similar faucets. I am glad that I selected this one. I strongly recommend this faucet to anyone who likes to cook (or juice) at home.
customer_reviews.author: Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Excellent kitchen faucet
customer_reviews.text: We installed this on a double sink. To make temperature and volume control convenient from either sink, we rotated the control to face forward, and reversed the hot and cold supply lines to maintain hot to the left, and cold to the right. It is very easy to set spray versus normal flow, and the pull down head works easily.
customer_reviews.author: GARY

customer_reviews.title: Its ok
customer_reviews.text: It does the job. Just waiting for the cheap hoses to leak. They all do over time, some faster than others. The button on the sprayer also stopped working within one week. Its supposed to give you more water pressure while spraying.
customer_reviews.author: D. D.

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality faucet for years of service
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Kohler faucet in this style that I have purchased in the last 5 or so years (the first one is still going strong, the second one I bought was installed in another house). The spray pattern of this sprayer differs from the one I purchased a few years ago in that it is more of an oblong spray and not a round spray pattern. When installing this type of faucet that has counter weights to aid in the retracting of the spray handle, you must check to make sure there is no obstructions under the sink that might impede the retraction of the hose.
customer_reviews.author: MidwestMother

customer_reviews.title: great look, great features
customer_reviews.text: I especially love the flat spray--really cleans stuff off plates. It is meant for a deep sink. We originally installed it with the sink that want in the house and there was a lot of splatter, but when we decided to replace the countertops, we got a deeper sink and it works beautifully. Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: K. M.

customer_reviews.title: Buy this one
customer_reviews.text: This faucet looks great. Lot of clearance for deep sinks. Super easy to install. Easy to clean. Only problem is power spray mode got stuck in the on position. Cannot turn off. So it blasts everything. Even disassembled the handle. Still stuck.
customer_reviews.author: S.O'Grady

customer_reviews.title: Instructions are flawed
customer_reviews.text: You need to be aware that when the instructions tell you to turn on the water, that the hose for the sprayer underneath the sink will begin spraying water all under your sink. There is no mention of the need to prepare for this. Also, even though the instructions tell you at the top that you need plumber's putty, there are no instructions for when or where to use it. I made a special trip to Home Depot to pick up a can of this. Never used it. I'm not a plumber, so I'm just following the instructions as written.
customer_reviews.author: Angela J Tabor

customer_reviews.title: Great quality.  Great style.
customer_reviews.text: With so many choices we were not sure what to buy. Having never had a faucet with a brushed surface we were not sure if this would be easier or harder to keep this clean. By far this is easier to keep clean than the polished chrome faucets that we have used for the past 30 years. The controls are very easy to operate. The pull-out head has a long hose on it. It is great for filling a large pot on the counter, next to the sink. The sprayer is easy to use. Overall the style is just what we wanted and looks great in our recently updated kitchen. We would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Kitchen Faucet
customer_reviews.text: Great kitchen faucet. Simple and easy temp control, flow control and drip tight operation. Best feature is the single controller and pedestal design, which minimizes the drip mess that occurs with conventional handle arrangements, and makes it simple to keep the sink top clean and dry. Some reviewers did not like flow-off button on the spray head because it works opposite from conventional kitchen sprayers, but I found it easy to get used to and simpler to operate. I prefer that the spray head does not lock closed. One less thing to think about.
customer_reviews.author: RandyMolson

customer_reviews.title: did no live up to Kohler reputation
customer_reviews.text: easy to install , looks good easy to use. water supply hoses are cheaply made and they kink when you try to tighten to supply valve. spray head drips for awhile after shut off .makes you feel the faucet is leaking I expected a better product from Kohler. I wish I bought a Moen instead , I never had these issues with their products.
customer_reviews.author: Salah

customer_reviews.title: The only thing I don't love about this is that when you change the water ...
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I don't love about this is that when you change the water to spray function, it doesn't automatically default back to regular flow after turning it off. You have to switch it back on the handle every time.
customer_reviews.author: C. Kalick

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic faucet
customer_reviews.text: This is a marvelous faucet. Installed with the temp regulation handle which goes left to hot and right to cold rather than front and back. The sprayer is not a round spray by like a fan which is fantastic for clearing the sink of stuff to the disposal. Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Judith Geffers

customer_reviews.title: Looks Good, But.....
customer_reviews.text: Very nice looking product and functional, however product lasted two years and started leaking from the handle. This is my second purchase of this (my wife likes it) and the first has a lifetime guarantee and they will replace the cartridge, but you are on for the labor, so if you do not mind doing a little handiwork and repair, you might want to buy it.
customer_reviews.author: AreDub

customer_reviews.title: The installation was easy, just followed the directions and watched the video ...
customer_reviews.text: Just installed the faucet today, the hardest part of the installation was taking out the old faucet. The installation was easy, just followed the directions and watched the video on Amazon. I like how the mount takes only two screws, one would think that wouldn't be enough, but I think it works fine. We'll see how it holds up in the coming days. The faucet looks really nice and works fine also.
customer_reviews.author: J. J. Tani

customer_reviews.title: A Win for Us
customer_reviews.text: Love this faucet. Great pull-0down spray feature that really helps with clean up! Sleek and stream-lined but not too straight-lined. Definitely a win for us! One thing is that we plan to replace our current sink with something deeper. That will help with the sometimes spray-back situation that happens.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Scherr

customer_reviews.title: Kohler is Always Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: As expected, this new Kohler kitchen faucet was easy to install and looks great and functions exactly as it should. Pay a little more for good quality and a solid warranty and you'll always be pleased. Kohler has a long reputation for making great quality products.
customer_reviews.author: Perry VoScott

customer_reviews.title: Supply Lines Too Short
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace the same model (Simplice) purchased 18 months ago that started leaking. The supply lines on this faucet are not long enough to reach the shut off valves at the bottom of a standard size cabinet. (4” too short). Plan to buy line extensions before you install. No reason for Kohler to make these lines so short.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: We've had this now for a few months. Awesome faucet for the kitchen. Very heavy built, functions and looks flawless. You can tell the engineers went above and beyond on this one from the long spray hose to the magnetic head that locks securely, to the ease of installation. I've installed many faucets, and this one is by far the easiest and fastest I've ever seen.
customer_reviews.author: Dane Troyer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great kitchen faucet
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this faucet. It has some great controls on the sprayer and the pull-out hose is very handy - locks back in place every time with a strong magnet. I’m very happy with the height - I can fit the largest pots in my sink for filling.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Hyde

product_meta.title: KOHLER K-596-VS Simplice Kitchen Faucet, Vibrant Stainless
product_meta.description:
Style:High Arch| Color:Vibrant StainlessAn innovative fit for a variety of kitchens and tasks, this Simplicial kitchen faucet combines an elegant, universal design with exceptional ergonomics and functionality. The high arch swing spout rotates 360 degrees, while the smoothly maneuvering spray head pulls down into the sink for up close tasks, or out of the sink to fill pots. Sculpted buttons on the spray head ensure simple operation even with wet, soapy hands. Sweep spray creates a wide, forceful blade of water for superior cleaning. Kohler's new docking system, Docketed, secures the pull down spray head to the spout using magnetic force.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The new Simplice pull-down kitchen faucet beautifully combines an elegant transitional high-arch design with exceptional ergonomics and functionality to deliver a truly innovative faucet solution for a wide variety of kitchen applications. The Simplice sprayhead utilizes solid sculpted buttons to provide improved operation even with wet or soapy hands. It also includes a pause function to temporarily pause water flow to permit movement of sprayhead out of sink area to fill pots.
feature_bullets: Pull down kitchen faucet: Allows you to control water with one hand and reaches beyond the sink to complete other kitchen tasks

3 function spray head: Includes stream, boost, and sweep spray technologies. Boost allows you to increase flow rate by 30 percent. Sweep spray has angled nozzles that create a powerful blade to clean your dishes and sink
Easy install: Hose and spray head pre-installed. Comes with flexible supply lines for easy water hook up. 1 or 3 hole installation with escutcheon/deck plate included
Magnetic docking: Docknetic magnetic docking system securely locks the spray head into place
Made to last: Ceramic disc valves exceed industry standards of longevity, performance that is made to last the life in your kitchen
Lasting finish: Our premium corrosion and tarnish resistant finishes are made to last
Lifetime limited warranty: Have the confidence in Kohler faucet products knowing they are backed by our lifetime limited warranty
